text.value: Date cannot be in the future and older than a month from today.
What is the condition of baby?
Does the baby have any of the following danger signs?
Each baby will be asked about individually.
Please enter a name for the baby to identify them in the app. You can change it later.
Should be between 35.6 cms and 70 cms.
Should be between 1500 grams and 5000 grams.
Were they initiated on breastfeeding within on hour of delivery?
Please counsel the family and refer the child to the nearest health center where the baby can be immunized.
Sections will repeat if multiple babies were delivered. Please fill out one section per baby.
What is the outcome for the woman?
If babies were delivered, you will have the chance to report on them Next >.
After reporting a death, the person's profile will be locked. If reported in error, you may undo the death report from the profile.
Did the woman deliver any babies before she died?
Date cannot be in the future and older than a month from today.
What was the place of death?
Can not be more than babies delivered.
Select this only if more than 3 babies were delivered.
Date cannot be in the future and older than a month from today.
Does the woman have any of the following danger signs?
Any additional PNC visits, please report the number of visits below to be counted in the total.
Which PNC visits have taken place so far?
The WHO recommends PNC visits within 24 hours and on 3 days, 7 days, and 6 weeks from date of delivery.
Lactating mothers need to eat more than usual to feed their baby well. Ask the woman to eat a variety of foods, especially extra fluids, fruits, and vegetables.
For the first 6 months, give the baby breastmilk only.
To keep the baby warm, use kangaroo mother care, wrap the baby with clothes and cover the head, and keep the baby in a warm room.
Always sleep with the baby under a long-lasting insecticide treated net (LLIN).
Keep the baby's umbilical cord clean and dry.
Please conduct a danger sign follow-up for the mother in 3 days.
Please conduct a danger sign follow-up for the baby in 3 days.
Please continue to refer the woman to the health facility at the appropriate time.
To finish, be sure to click the Submit button.
The WHO recommends routine PNC visits at 24 hours, 3 days, 7 days, and 6 weeks from the date of delivery.
Within 24 hours (check this box if facility delivery)

bind.calculate: if(selected(../fever, 'yes') or selected(../severe_headache, 'yes') or selected(../vaginal_bleeding, 'yes') or selected(../vaginal_discharge, 'yes') or selected(../convulsion, 'yes'), 'yes', 'no')

if(selected(../infected_umbilical_cord, 'yes') or selected(../convulsion, 'yes') or selected(../difficulty_feeding, 'yes') or selected(../vomit, 'yes') or selected(../drowsy, 'yes') or selected(../stiff, 'yes') or selected(../yellow_skin, 'yes') or selected(../fever, 'yes') or selected(../blue_skin, 'yes'), 'yes', 'no')
